name: Wait
description: Pauses the execution of the current thread for the specified amount of time in milliseconds. This function is non-blocking and allows other threads to continue running.

parameters.name: milliseconds
parameters.description: The time to wait in milliseconds

returns.description: This function does not return a value

example:
-- Wait for 1 second
Wait(1000)

-- Wait for 5 seconds
Wait(5000)

-- Example in a loop
while true do
    print("Hello World")
    Wait(2000) -- Wait 2 seconds between each print
end
notes: Wait() must be used inside a CreateThread() function
The function uses JavaScript's Promise-based setTimeout internally
Minimum wait time is effectively 1ms due to JavaScript limitations
